title: 'When those things click, it's on like Donkey Kong': Witnessing Vlad Jr.'s epic October run
content: What's it like watching the face of the franchise dominate? We asked those around the Blue Jays superstar.

title: Jays, 'team of uncommon men,' rebound to tie WS
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a two-run homer off Shohei Ohtani, and the Blue Jays shook off their epic 18-inning loss to even the World Series with a 6-2 victory over the Dodgers in Game 4.

title: Jackson: 'Busted' Melo pairing forced Knicks exit
content: Hall of Fame coach Phil Jackson discussed his failed relationship with former Knicks star Carmelo Anthony in a new book, saying the "busted" relationship led to his departure as team president in 2017.

title: Jordan: Load management never should happen
content: Michael Jordan didn't hold back on load management in the NBA, saying on NBC: "It shouldn't be needed, first and foremost."

title: Patriots trade White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: Poll: Many NFL fans want more games despite risk
content: Many NFL teams have lost star players to season-ending injuries this season, or played without them for significant stretches -- but a new poll finds that many football fans want more games, even if it means more risk.

title: Ohtani rues 'regrettable' inning, takes Game 4 loss
content: A day after an 18-inning victory for the Dodgers in Game 3, Los Angeles star Shohei Ohtani took the mound in Game 4, wound up with the loss, and finished hitless in the batter's box, as the Toronto Blue Jays evened the World Series at 2-2 with a 6-2 win.

title: LSU interim living in moment despite 'dream' job
content: Interim LSU coach Frank Wilson called his promotion "something you would dream of" but eschewed the opportunity discuss his prospects for retaining the job beyond the rest of this season.

title: Dad: Aspinall 'can't see anything' out of right eye
content: The father of Tom Aspinall said the UFC heavyweight champion "can't see anything" out of his right eye days after the disastrous eye poke he suffered against Ciryl Gane at UFC 321.

title: ðŸ’ª Latest NFL Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 9. Plus, we picked the best offseason signing, hiring or draft pick for each roster.

title: Guide to every NFL team's trade deadline: Candidates to be moved, targets who could fit, biggest needs
content: Let's outline deadline plans for all 32 franchises, including who could be moved or targeted before 4 p.m. ET on Nov. 4. Here's everything to know.

title: Trade deadline intel ahead of Week 9: Everything we're hearing on buzzy names
content: The latest on Breece Hall, Trey Hendrickson, Jakobi Meyers and several under-the-radar trade targets.

title: Cam Skattebo's injury: What it means for the RB, the Giants and their future
content: Skattebo's injury is a massive loss for the Giants. It's equally demoralizing for the team and the fan base, who were falling in love with the rookie.

title: Men's college basketball megapreview, predictions for this season
content: Can Florida repeat? Here's your guide to the new season, from Final Four picks to conference winner predictions.

title: Top 25 women's NCAA basketball players ranked going into 2025-26
content: A sophomore sits atop our preseason player rankings, which include multiple players from UConn, UCLA and LSU.

title: 'Toughest player I've ever seen': The Legend of Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

content: Our insiders break down standout moments and answer the biggest questions from the first days of the NBA season.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams land after one week of regular-season play
content: Hot starts or early burnouts? Where all 30 teams rank after one week of the 2025-26 NBA regular season.

title: What to know with 100 days until the Milan-Cortina Olympics
content: The 2026 Olympics will have more sports and more athletes than any Winter Games in history. We've got 100 things to know.

title: Five reasons Brian Kelly failed at LSU
content: Kelly's departure could be pinned on trouble with his staff, trouble fitting in or a mad scramble for Lane Kiffin.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 9
content: Does Notre Dame need to run the table? We try to make sense of the constantly evolving playoff picture conference by conference.

title: Carousel chaos meets Lane Kiffin, and what he does next will be interesting
content: More than $150M in buyouts and multiple job openings mean Lane Kiffin is the center of the CFB universe.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo's race to 1,000 goals: When will he reach that remarkable number?
content: It seems like a matter of when, not if, Ronaldo scores his 1,000th goal, especially after reaching 950 this weekend. But when will he do it, and can anyone else possibly follow him?

title: Why are USWNT players signing with clubs in Europe -- and can the NWSL stop it?
content: While NWSL execs worry about USWNT players choosing European clubs, the lure of UEFA Women's Champions League clubs isn't going away.

title: What's left for the 2026 recruiting class: Coaching changes, flips to watch and more
content: We've updated our player rankings. There's a new top QB and new five-star but classes could be in flux.

title: 200 plays on a wristband?! Why some NFL QBs wear play sheets on their wrists and others don't
content: Some QBs like the way wristbands speed up the process, but others, such as Dak Prescott, don't want to lose eye contact.

title: Why the Saints are turning to QB Tyler Shough now
content: After benching Spencer Rattler during their Week 8 loss, the Saints will start their second-round pick Sunday.

title: 'A moment of glory': How the daughter of two Ohio State 'i dotters' fulfilled her destiny
content: Sydney Reeves grew up with two Ohio State sousaphone players for parents. She always knew what she had to do.

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Daniel Jones, downgrade Travis Kelce
content: The most and least favorable matchups in the NFL for this week's games at the four key fantasy positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Trade value index: Trust in Drake Maye, Harold Fannin Jr.
content: With less than a month to the fantasy trade deadline, the rest-of-season rankings identify worthy targets.

title: College football futures: Is now the time to bet on Marcel Reed and Texas A&M?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado breaks down what to know.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Haaland to replace VinÃ­cius at Real Madrid?
content: Real Madrid could look to Man City striker Erling Haaland to replace forward VinÃ­cius JÃºnior. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'Will Spend $1.4 Trillion': Sam Altman As OpenAI Restructures To Chase Scale
content: Soon after ChatGPT was released to the public in late 2022, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman told employees they were on the cusp of a new technological revolution.

title: Air India CEO Vows Reform In First Public Comments After Deadly Crash
content: Air India's CEO vowed on Wednesday to improve internal practices after a plane crash in June killed 260 people, in his first public comments about the accident that he said would contribute to a "challenging" year for the airline.

title: Love Your Tea And Coffee? Protect Your Enamel With Sensodyne Pronamel
content: We all brush our teeth every day but how often do we think about what truly protects them? That invisible armour that keeps your teeth strong and healthy is called enamel. Once it's gone, it doesn't come back.

title: 2 Arrested In Rs 50 Lakh Digital Arrest Scam Targeting Senior Citizens
content: The Mumbai Cyber Police have arrested two members of a cybercrime gang that duped senior citizens by posing as senior police and investigation officers. They created fear of arrest and falsely implicated victims in money-laundering cases.

title: Exclusive: Inside Bastar's Final Battle To End Last 300 Maoists
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah's declaration to end Maoists by March 31, 2026 has injected new urgency into security operations across central India.

title: Trump Expects 'Great Meeting' With China's Xi In Asia Tour Grand Finale
content: US President Donald Trump voiced optimism on Wednesday on the eve of crunch trade talks with China's Xi Jinping, while also announcing that a deal with South Korea was "pretty much" finalised.

title: CCTV Footage Shows Doctor Who Died By Suicide Entering Hotel Room Alone
content: CCTV footage obtained from a hotel in Maharashtra's Satara district has confirmed that the 28-year-old woman doctor, whose death last week sparked political outrage, had checked into the lodge alone on the night she died.

title: 'Want To See My Brother Shivakumar As Chief Minister': DK Suresh
content: Former Congress MP D K Suresh said he desires to see his elder brother and deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar become the CM, and that if it is in his fate, he will occupy the top post.

title: India Can Meet 2032 Power Demand Without New coal Plants: Report
content: India does not need any new coal power plant beyond those already under construction to meet its electricity demand by 2032, according to a recent study.

title: 'Nothing Unusual': NATO Downplays US Move To Cut Troops In Europe
content: NATO said Wednesday it had been informed in advance of US plans to reduce some of its troops deployed on the alliance's eastern flank, describing the move as an "adjustment" and nothing "unusual".

title: India Slams "Biased" Myanmar Rights Report On Pahalgam Attack At United Nations
content: At the 80th session of the UNGA, India called out "baseless and biased" remarks in a recent report on the human rights situation in Myanmar, even as it reiterated its commitment to peace, stability, and global disarmament.

title: Pakistan's Lahore Continues To Remain World's Most Polluted City
content: Pakistan's Lahore continues to remain at the top of global pollution charts with an AQI of more than 300 according to Swiss air quality monitor IQAir as smog covered the region, local media reported.

title: Dawood Ibrahim Aide Emerges As Drug Syndicate 'Kingpin', Arrested In Goa
content: The Narcotics Control Bureau has arrested Danish Chikna, a close aide of fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim and "kingpin" of a drug syndicate, from Goa, officials said.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink To Run Technical, Security Demos In Mumbai From October 30
content: Elon Musk-led Starlink is scheduled to conduct demonstration runs in Mumbai on October 30 and 31 to demonstrate compliance with India's security and technical requirements for satellite broadband services.

title: Ex-Maoist With Rs 5 Lakh Bounty Now A Security Guard At Odisha Blood Bank
content: Dhananjoy Gope (alias Sudhir), a former Maoist from Odisha's Malkangiri district, traded his gun for a uniform six years back.

title: Zubeen Garg's Ashes Immersed In Brahmaputra River
content: Cultural icon Zubeen Garg's ashes were immersed in the Brahmaputra River by his wife Garima, 37 days after he was cremated with lakhs of followers mourning his untimely demise.

title: Thousands Face The Axe As Global Firms Look For Return On Big AI Spending
content: Amazon said it would cut up to 14,000 jobs from its corporate workforce, joining Target, Procter & Gamble and others in axing thousands of office roles.

title: Bihar's Caste Counts: NDA And Mahagathbandhan Give Tickets To Core Vote Blocs
content: As Bihar heads into a crucial electoral battle, its major political alliances-the NDA and the Mahagathbandhan (MGB)-have quietly shelved their lofty slogans in favor of hard-nosed caste arithmetic.

title: 'Go straight to paradise: Crushed by Op Sindoor, JeM chief gets desperate
content: Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Masood Azhar has launched 'Jamaat-ul-Mominaat,' a new women's wing, detailing plans for recruitment, indoctrination, and deployment in a 21-minute audio message. Women will undergo training mirroring male programs, with the promise of paradise for joining the "global jihad" mission.

title: Russia ignores Trump: Kremlin tests another n-powered weapon - what is Poseidon?
content: President Putin announced Russia's successful test of the nuclear-powered 'Poseidon' underwater drone, claiming it's uninterceptable and surpasses the 'Sarmat' missile. This follows a recent test of the 'Burevestnik' missile, occurring amidst Western pressure over Ukraine and Donald Trump's call for Russia to end the conflict.

title: Trade trouble? India-bound Russian oil tanker takes U-turn; here's why
content: A Russian crude oil tanker bound for India has altered its course and is now stationary in the Baltic Sea. This could indicate possible complications in crude oil trade between the two nations following stricter US sanctions against Russia.

title: 'PM, CM seats not vacant': Shah taunts Rahul, Tejashwi for dynastic politics
content: Union home minister Amit Shah launched a strong attack on the INDIA bloc in Bihar, accusing Congress and RJD leaders of dynastic politics and corruption. He asserted that the ambitions of Sonia Gandhi and Lalu Prasad Yadav to see their sons in top posts would fail, as the Prime Minister and Chief Minister positions are not vacant.

title: Amazon's biggest layoffs: Read HR head's email to employees; Reveals the reason
content: Amazon is laying off approximately 14,000 corporate employees, its largest job cuts since the pandemic. Despite posting $18 billion in quarterly profits, the company cites transformative AI technology as a reason for reducing bureaucracy and redirecting resources. Affected employees will receive 90 days of full pay and benefits, severance, and job placement support.

title: 'PM will dance if ...': Rahul targets Modi in Bihar rally; BJP calls him 'goon'
content: Rahul Gandhi launched his Bihar election campaign, accusing PM Modi of seeking votes and undermining democracy. He criticized Modi's economic policies and alleged the BJP controls Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, asserting the party opposes social justice and caste census. The state is set for a contest between NDA and Mahagathbandhan.

title: Maruti Suzuki's big product offensive: 8 new SUVs, 50% market share
content: Suzuki plans a major expansion in India. The company aims for 50% market share and to become the leading EV maker. Eight new SUVs will be introduced in the next five to six years. A significant investment of Rs 70,000 crore is planned by FY 2030-31.

title: 'Tell your husband to go easy on me' â€“ Rahulâ€™s complaint to legendary cricketerâ€™s wife
content: KL Rahul shared a humorous anecdote about his IPL 2025 camaraderie with Kevin Pietersen. Their constant banter, which extended to Rahul jokingly complaining to Pietersen's wife, became a highlight for Delhi Capitals fans.  Rahul revealed the on-field exchanges were just a fraction of their playful rivalry, showcasing a strong bond.

title: Saudi Arabia's top AI company makes a 'China promise' to the US government: Will never â€¦
content: Saudi Arabian AI startup Humain's CEO Tareq Amin is confident the US will approve advanced chip sales, following assurances that Humain will not use Chinese equipment.  Humain aims to be a top global computing capacity provider, contingent on access to US-made AI chips, with discussions between the US and Saudi Arabia progressing positively.

title: Husband missing for 7 years: How Chhattisgarh woman won HC nod for central government pension
content: A wife whose husband disappeared received a significant victory from the Chhattisgarh High Court. The court ruled she is entitled to central government pension benefits. Her husband, a senior technician at Bhilai Steel Plant, went missing in 2010.

title: Compulsory KYV is here: Stuck and fleeced at toll gate, thanks to bureaucracy & bad tech
content: Have FASTag? Now, prove that itâ€™s authentic. Be prepared to upload documents and photos of your car on apps that refuse to work. If you have doubts, donâ€™t expect easy answers amid general confusion and a process thatâ€™s user-unfriendly

title: â€˜Tough timingâ€™: GM axes 200 salaried staff; layoffs hit days after profit surge
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Who is Shivangi Singh? IAF pilot who took prez Murmu on Rafale sortie
content: Wing Commander Shivangi Singh, India's sole woman Rafale pilot, gained national attention as President Droupadi Murmu experienced a historic sortie in the fighter jet. Singh, part of the elite Golden Arrows squadron, flew the French-made aircraft from Ambala Air Force Station. President Murmu described the flight as "unforgettable," boosting her pride in India's defense capabilities.

title: â€˜Ikkisâ€™ Trailer: Agastya Nanda delivers a powerful portrayal of war hero Arun Khetarpal
content: The trailer for 'Ikkis â€“ The Untold True Story of Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal' has been released, showcasing Agastya Nanda as the young war hero. Directed by Sriram Raghavan, the film highlights patriotism, youthful determination, and the emotional sacrifices made during the 1971 Indo-Pak war. It also features Dharmendra and Jaideep Ahlawat, promising a powerful cinematic experience.

title: First T20I: 9.4 overs & glimpse of Surya's return to form! IND vs AUS abandoned due to rain
content: Rain halted the first T20 International between India and Australia in Canberra after just 9.4 overs. India, at 97 for 1, saw skipper Suryakumar Yadav find form with a blistering 62-run partnership with Shubman Gill. Abhishek Sharma also contributed a quick 19 before falling. The promising contest was abandoned, leaving fans disappointed.

title: Delhi's attempt to make rain: The good, the bad, and what if it really pours
content: And yet, every so often, we try. From Beijing to Dubai, humans have spent decades firing silver iodide into clouds, hoping to bend the weather to our will. The latest to attempt this act of atmospheric persuasion was Delhi â€” a city so desperate for clean air it decided to summon rain from a clear sky.

title: Ryan Kesler case: Ex-Ducks star faces latest update in sexual conduct charges
content: Former Anaheim Ducks forward Ryan Kesler has been charged with two counts of fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct in Michigan. According to journalist Katie Strang, the allegations involve a 16-year-old victim and date back to January 1, 2025. Kesler has pleaded not guilty and denied all claims, while the NHL and Anaheim Ducks have not yet commented.

title: IND vs AUS: Arshdeepâ€™s omission sparks outrage; Gambhir and selectors face backlash
content: India's decision to omit Arshdeep Singh, their leading T20I wicket-taker, for the first T20I against Australia has sparked widespread debate. Despite overcast conditions favoring swing, the left-arm pacer was surprisingly left out, prompting criticism from former players and fans. This exclusion raises questions about India's selection strategy with the T20 World Cup approaching.

title: 'Pagla Shahbaz': Kolkata man in lockup strips, dances; held for arms smuggling
content: A 24-year-old man arrested in an arms smuggling case caused chaos at a south Kolkata police station by stripping and engaging in obscene singing and dancing. Mohammad Shahbaz, known locally as 'Pagla Shahbaz', also allegedly threatened officers when they attempted to restrain him. Police have filed a complaint and launched an internal inquiry into the unprecedented behavior.

title: 'Affront to democracy': Priyanka attacks SIR; calls it a way of 'cheating' in elections
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has declared the party's firm opposition to the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter lists in Kerala. She asserted that the process, as witnessed in Bihar, undermines democracy and constitutes electoral fraud. Priyanka is on a two-day visit to her Wayanad constituency, inaugurating development projects.

title: Brittany Mahomes: Patrick admits sheâ€™s the real head coach at home
content: Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes revealed that his wife, Brittany, handles all Halloween costume decisions for their family.  Their son has already picked out the outfits, with Mahomes admitting he's unaware of his own costume. This tradition has become a fan favorite, showcasing the star player's playful side off the field.

title: Life-threatening injury! Australian cricketer in critical condition after ball hits neck
content: A 17-year-old cricketer is fighting for his life after a devastating blow to the neck ahead of a match in Melbourne. The rising star was struck while warming up and is now on life support. The tragic incident has prompted calls for improved safety measures in cricket, drawing parallels to the Phil Hughes tragedy.

title: 'Crushed dreams': Annamalai targets DMK govt over mega racket; cites ED report
content: Former Tamil Nadu BJP president K Annamalai accused the DMK government of an Rs 888-crore cash-for-jobs scam in the Municipal Administration and Water Supply Department. He alleged 2,538 posts were sold for Rs 35 lakh each, denying deserving candidates jobs. Annamalai demanded a judicially monitored CBI probe into the alleged corruption.

title: Video: Bullets rain on Indian-origin bizman in Canada; Bishnoi gang claims responsibility
content: A shocking video captured the targeted assassination of 68-year-old Indian-origin businessman Darshan Singh Sahsi in Abbotsford, Canada.  Sahsi was shot dead in his car outside his home.  A close aide of jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi claimed responsibility, alleging Sahsi refused to pay extortion money. This incident follows the Canadian government's designation of the Bishnoi syndicate as a terrorist entity.

title: Watch: Bihar cop allegedly harasses siblings amid election vigilance
content: A viral video from Biharâ€™s Barsoi in Katihar district shows a police officer allegedly misbehaving with a man and his sister at a restaurant during election-time checks. The man claims they were unfairly harassed. The incident has triggered outrage among locals, prompting Katihar Police to launch an internal inquiry into the officerâ€™s conduct.

title: Why Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift turned down Kamala Harrisâ€™ campaign request
content: Kamala Harris' 2024 campaign reportedly made persistent, yet unsuccessful, attempts to involve Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce in political outreach.  Despite Swift's powerful endorsement, both she and Kelce declined opportunities to feature in campaign events or on the Kelce brothers' podcast, prioritizing their respective careers and personal boundaries over direct political campaigning.

title: Drake & Adin Ross accused of promoting gambling to minors in Missouri
content: Rapper Drake and streamer Adin Ross are facing a class action lawsuit in Missouri for allegedly promoting illegal online gambling on Stake. The lawsuit claims they misled fans by appearing to use their own money, when Stake was paying them millions to promote the site, potentially causing young viewers to lose money.

title: 'Husband died waiting to see Vijay': Karur stampede victim's wife rejects TVK relief; returns Rs 20L
content: A family of a stampede victim has returned Rs 20 lakh relief from the TVK party, citing deep disappointment. They were angered that the party took estranged relatives to meet their leader, Vijay, instead of offering personal condolences. The family felt their name was misused, leading to the return of the funds via bank transfer.

title: â€˜Itâ€™s a yoga poseâ€™: MP teacher suspended for â€˜namaz-likeâ€™ steps; inquiry ordered
content: A government school teacher in Burhanpur district was suspended for allegedly making students perform Namaz-like postures before Surya Namaskar. The District Education Officer confirmed the suspension after students and parents corroborated the complaint. The teacher denies the allegations, stating he was following the prescribed yoga curriculum.

title: Can Indians get a UAE Visa on arrival? Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s changed and whoâ€™s eligible
content: Indians can now travel to the UAE without pre-applying for a visa â€” if they meet specific eligibility rules. In 2025, the UAE widened its visa-on-arrival scheme, adding six new qualifying countries to the list for Indian residents and visa holders. Hereâ€™s a complete guide to who qualifies, what documents you need, and how long you can stay.

title: 'Please take me back to jail': Gangster who fled India on 'dunki' route begs to return
content: A Gurgaon gangster, Sunil Sardhania, who fled to the US on parole last year, has returned to India after a harrowing experience on the illegal 'dunki' route. Kidnapped twice in Colombia due to payment issues, he preferred prison over the treacherous journey. Sardhania was apprehended at Delhi's IGI Airport upon his arrival.

title: How a freezer experiment in 1946 led to mankindâ€™s first attempt to make artificial rain
content: Delhi has revived artificial rainmaking after over 50 years, conducting a cloud-seeding trial to combat severe winter smog. A Cessna aircraft released flares over the capital, marking the third such experiment since Independence. This initiative, a collaboration with IIT Kanpur, aims to leverage technology against the city's persistent air pollution crisis.

title: NITI Aayog report: Service sector surges; jobs trail growth
content: India's booming services sector, contributing over half of national output, faces a reality check. Despite job growth, employment remains largely informal and low-paying, creating a paradox of strong output without quality jobs. Regional and gender disparities are stark, with a growing mismatch between education and job quality, demanding targeted policies for inclusive growth.

title: xQc shocked as 39daph reveals truth about her pet betta fish
content: Twitch streamer 39daph is facing backlash after a clip of her casually recounting how she harmed her pet betta fish as a child went viral. Viewers expressed shock at her emotionless tone while describing the cruel acts, including ripping out its fins and flushing it. The incident has sparked debate and comparisons to past streamer pet controversies.

title: Priya Kapur takes over late Sunjay Kapurâ€™s business: Legal row with Karismaâ€™s kids; disputed will sparks new petition
content: Karisma Kapoor's children are contesting the will of her ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur, alleging it was forged by his third wife, Priya Kapur. The children claim the will, which reportedly leaves the entire estate to Priya, contains errors and seeks a share of their father's â‚¹30,000 crore assets.

title: Rohit Sharma creates history: Becomes top-ranked ODI batter - joins elite list of Indians
content: Rohit Sharma has etched his name in history, becoming the oldest Indian to reach the No. 1 ICC ODI batting ranking at 38. His stellar performances against Australia propelled him to the top spot for the first time. This remarkable feat places him alongside cricketing legends like Tendulkar and Kohli, marking a significant moment for Indian cricket.

title: Exclusive - Shilpa Shinde to replace Shubhangi Atre as Angoori Bhabhi in Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai?
content: After nearly a decade, Shilpa Shinde may reprise her iconic role as Angoori Bhabhi in Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai. The makers are  planning a major revamp of the popular sitcom with new elements and a fresh storyline.

title: 8th Pay Commission: How much salary hike should central govt staff expect?
content: 8th Pay Commission salary hike news: Central government employees and pensioners have reason to cheer as the Cabinet approves the terms of reference for the 8th Pay Commission. New salary and pension levels are expected to be effective from January 1, 2026. The commission will assess pay structures and post-retirement benefits, with its report due in 12-18 months.

title: Bengaluru man kills loverâ€™s 7-year-old daughter for disturbing privacy
content: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering his girlfriend's seven-year-old daughter. The accused reportedly killed the child, a class 2 student, because she was a "disturbance" to his private time with her mother. He confessed to repeatedly slamming the child's head on the floor and smothering her.

title: Timeline of past century's major pro sports gambling scandals
content: the rocky marriage of team sports and illicit gambling dates back more than a century in the united states . no major professional sport appears immune to gambling scandals, as the following partial timeline suggests . a gambling scandal at the City College of new york involved players who at the time were playing in the NBA .

title: What Cade Cunningham is building in Detroit
content: Cade Cunningham lost the ball on offense, but gets it back for the Pistons with a chasedown block . he had just become a first-time All-Star and the driving fo foe . his first postseason win since 2008 was in the playoffs .

title: NBA gambling scandal follows familiar Mafia playbook
content: the alleged connection between the mafia and two former NBA players began through a little-known intermediary . prosecutors allege the intermediary was Robert L. Stroud, 67, a 67-year-old Louisville man with a criminal history . in 1994, he killed a man during an evening playing cards and gambling at a home .

title: Farm loan waiver: HC orders Bacchu Kadu, protesters to clear Wardha Road
content: the bench of the high court of the bombay high court takes suo motu cognisance of the ongoing Wardha Road blockade orchestrated by former MLA Omprakash alias Bacchu Kadu . the court expressed serious concern over the extreme inconvenience faced by the public . thousands were stranded in traffic gridlock that extended over 20 kilometres .

title: No, Saudi Arabia is not building a World Cup stadium on top of a skyscraper
content: video purporting to depict the concept supposedly reveals plans for a $1 billion, 46,000-seater arena in the futuristic new city of NEOM . it is unclear who created and initially shared the clip, which has sparked plenty of excitement online but also several questions .

title: Bottom 10: Hot seats keep getting hotter ... just ask Brian Kelly
content: "Take this job and shove it I ain't working here no more My woman done left And took all the reasons I was working for You better not try to stand in my way" a-walking out the door "Take This Job and Shove It," Johnny Paycheck Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, located behind the wall of industrial-sized cooling fans used to keep Pete Thamel's phone and laptop from overheating .

title: Why the 6-2 Patriots traded Keion White and Kyle Dugger -- and what could be next
content: the move comes ahead of Tuesday's trade deadline (4 p.m. ET) the Patriots have been one of the NFL's surprise teams and are in first place in the AFC East . the five-time defending division champions will play them at home in week 15 .

title: KSRTC launches state-wide safety audit after Kurnool bus fire accident
content: The move comes under the directive of Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy, who has instructed the managing directors of all four state-run transport corporations to ensure that every bus undergoes a thorough inspection

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Meghalaya Trinamool leader Zenith Sangma rejoins Congress
content: The central leadership of the West Bengal-based TMC has allegedly not been showing any interest in the State unit

title: J&K CM Omar Abdullah betrayed the poor by opposing land rights Bill: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Assembly on Tuesday (oCTOBER 28) rejected Para's bill on recognising proprietary rights for houses illegally built on government and community lands, with CM Abdullah saying its passage would "open floodgates for land grab"

title: APSRTC operations hit hard as Cyclone Montha batters Andhra coast
content: Over 50% of bus services suspended; heavy rain and blocked roads cause â‚¹10 crore revenue loss, says official

title: Assam government to probe â€˜singingâ€™ of Bangladesh's national anthem at Congress meeting: Officials
content: Instructions were â€œissued to the district commissioner to take legal action after confirming the truth of the incidentâ€, Mr. Paul said.

title: 2025 Kerala local body polls: State Election Commission holds meeting with political parties on polls arrangements
content: The 2025 local body polls are being held for 23,576 wards, excluding 36 wards of the Mattannur municipality in Kannur, where elections are due only in 2027

title: BMTC to install digital bus information displays at major bus stations
content: The smart display system, which will also double as an advertising platform, is part of BMTCâ€™s efforts to improve commuter experience and information access at its terminals, according to officials

title: ED claims irregularities in recruitment in Tamil Naduâ€™s MAWS department, Minister K.N. Nehru denies charge
content: In a statement, the DMK Minister referred to the EDâ€™s communication earlier this week and claimed that it was yet another attempt by the agency to malign the reputation of the Dravidian model of governance

title: Government begins free supply of essentials in Cyclone Montha-hit areas
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan says relief includes rice, pulses, sugar, onions, and oil for families in relief camps, while fishermen and handloom workers will receive 50 kg of rice each

title: Hindutva leaders demand withdrawal of restraining order against Kaneri Math seer
content: Basanagouda Patil Yatnal and Chakravarthi Sulibele called the restraining order against the seer an attempt to divide the Hindu community.

title: Safari trips reduced in Bandipur, Nagarahole
content: There has been an increase in the tourist footfall in both BandipurÂ and Nagarahole with instances of safari vehicles continuing to ply in the tourism zone even after 6 p.m.

title: A dream comes true for Irula tribal families in Cuddaloreâ€™s Sengodi village
content: After years of struggle, Irula families in the village have reclaimed their land and begun building houses under government housing schemes

title: Muivah exits home village, reiterates Naga sovereignty
content: The National Socialist Council of Nagalim leader addressed a large gathering in Manipurâ€™s Senapati on his way back to the NSCN (I-M)â€™s central headquarters near Dimapur in Nagaland

title: 'Nothing wrong with Air India ops': CEO on AAIB AI 171 crash prelim report
content: Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: Agony of losing homes to the giant waves along Uppada coast
content: Fisherfolk stand helpless in front of natureâ€™s fury as the Uppada village has lost 126.58 acres to the coastal erosion since 1980s

title: 51 Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: They surrender as part of 'Poona Margem - Punarwas se Punarjeevan' (rehabilitation for social integration), a rehabilitation initiative launched by Bastar Range police.

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder case: Meghalaya court frames charges against five accused
content: Police submitted a 790-page chargesheet before the court of the Judicial Magistrate First Class, Sohra Sub-Division, on September 5

title: Left union raises banner of revolt against KSRTC
content: Union members hold Statewide protest seeking reinstatement of employees whose contracts had been terminated and restoration of superclass service duties that had been cut down

title: Major amendments to building rules come into effect in Kerala
content: A significant change is that the classification of low-risk building has been expanded. With the removal of the 7-m height restriction, almost 80% of residential constructions will be eligible for building permit within minutes of applying. The category of buildings which can be cleared for construction by the local body secretary without the clearance of the district town planner has been expanded

title: DMK allowed encroachment of 10,000 acres in Pallikaranai marshland: Anbumani
content: Addressing the media, Dr. Anbumani said the marshland, which spread over 12,500 acres before 1967, had shrunk to 2,500 acres due to â€œunchecked encroachments and construction activitiesâ€ under successive DMK regimes

title: Political parties slam EC decision to go ahead with Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Kerala
content: At a meeting with Chief Electoral Officer (Kerala) Rathan Kelkar, senior political leaders air their objection and observe that SIRâ€™s overlap with the local body polls will mess up the latter exercise. They ask Kelkar to once again take up the demand with the Election Commission of India

title: India condemns â€˜blinkeredâ€™ U.N. report, calls for inclusive political dialogue in Myanmar
content: Lok Sabha MP Dilip Saikia said New Delhi continues to support all initiatives aimed at fostering trust and advancing a â€œMyanmar-owned and Myanmar-led pathâ€ toward peace, stability, and democracy

title: Vellappally Natesan calls for dissolution of Devaswom boards
content: SNDP Yogam general secretary says number of boards should be restricted to a maximum of two. He says a Minister should be appointed solely for Devaswom affiars

title: Kerala government, rice mill owners reach agreement on paddy procurement
content: Chief Minister says Cabinet will consider approving â‚¹63.37 crore as compensation to rice mill owners for losses incurred during the 2022-23 procurement year

title: India to fly home 500 from Thailand after scam hub raid: Thai PM
content: Many people staffing the fraud factories say they were trafficked into the hubs, although analysts say workers also go willingly to secure attractive salary offers

title: MaidenÂ globalÂ level â€˜MumbaiÂ ClimateÂ Weekâ€™ toÂ beÂ hostedÂ inÂ FebruaryÂ 2026
content: â€œThe event will bring together the best minds from across the Global South to find practical solutions for our climate challenges,â€ Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said

title: RJD defamed Bihar across world: Rajnath Singh in Darbhanga
content: Mr. Singh slammed the RJD, alleging that it made an "unrealistic promise" of providing a government job to each household in the State

title: T.N. CM Stalin appeals to all parties to show solidarity by attending November 2 meeting against SIR
content: â€œEven though the Opposition parties have differences of opinion with the government, I appeal to them to stand with us to thwart this impending man-made calamity in the form of the SIR,â€ Mr. Stalin said in Tenkasi

title: Rahul Gandhi promises justice to kin of deceased doctor in Maharashtraâ€™s Satara
content: Rahul Gandhi assured family of the deceased that he would pressure government to set up Special Investigation Team to probe doctorâ€™s death

title: Justice Subhendu Samanta takes charge as Andhra Pradesh High Court judge
content: Andhra Pradesh High Court Chief Justice Dhiraj Singh Thakur administered him the oath of office in the First Court Hall

title: Bihar Assembly polls: BJP running government through remote control using Nitish's face, alleges Rahul
content: Rahul Gandhi lambasted the ruling BJP at the Centre for being "against social justice" and pointed out that it was at the opposition partyâ€™s insistence that the Narendra Modi government agreed to a caste census

title: Swiss firms, research institutions have shown interest in Karnatakaâ€™s Quantum City development: Minister N.S. Boseraju
content: Discussions concerning the cityâ€™s development were held with representatives from leading global Quantum research institutions, including ETH Zurich and CERN, said the Minister

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Lalu wants to make his son Bihar CM, Sonia her son PM but both posts not vacant: Shah
content: Amit Shah termed the Mahagatbandhan as 'thug bandhan', alleging that Lalu Prasad is involved in fodder, bitumen and land-for-jobs scams, while Congress was involved in corruption cases worth â‚¹12 lakh crore

title: People of Vizianagaram, Srikakulam heave a sigh of relief with little impact of Cyclone Montha
content: Senior officials had monitored the cyclonic storm from control rooms set up in both Collectorsâ€™ offices. There are no human casualties due to heavy rains in any part of Vizianagaram district, says Officials

title: Kerala to form Cabinet sub-committee to study MoU with Centre on PM-SHRI
content: CPI State Secretary Binoy Viswam told The Hindu that the political ground for the partyâ€™s four Ministers abstaining from Wednesdayâ€™s cabinet had ceased to exist

title: Implement Indian Knowledge System, NEP 2020 earnestly:Â MaharashtraÂ Governor Acharya DevvratÂ tells varsities
content: Further, Governor Acharya Devvrat has asked the universities to submit quarterly reports. Expert slams the move as regressive and impractical, calling it the RSS agenda

title: Watch: Where do India-Afghanistan ties stand under Taliban rule?
content: What is the situation inside Afghanistan? We are joined by Dr. Nilofar Sakhi, a faculty member at the Elliott School of International Affairs at George Washington University. She is also the president of the Andiana Foundation, a US-based think tank, and a nonresident senior fellow at the Atlantic Council.

title: Ladakh violence: Supreme Court allows Wangchukâ€™s wife Angmo to launch a keener challenge to Wangchuk's detention
content: A Bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and N.V. Anajaria has given activist Sonam Wangchukâ€™s wife Angmo a week to file the amended petition

title: Increase in Tamil Naduâ€™s elephant population heartening: Madras High Court Chief Justice
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava says, the increase in the population of the gentle giants from 3,063 in 2024 to 3,170 in 2025 amounts to significant growth

title: Controversy erupts over colour change at Keralaâ€™s JN stadium renovation
content: When contacted by The Hindu, GCDA chairperson K. Chandran Pillai said the colour change had been discussed beforehand and was permitted for improved aesthetics

title: Cyclonic storm to weaken into deep depression before noon
content: The storm is likely to move northwestwards across coastal Andhra Pradesh and maintain its intensity of cyclonic storm during the next 6 hours and weaken further into a deep depression during the subsequent 6 hours, the IMD bulletin of 7 a.m. said.

title: Delhi Police arrest man for espionage, links to foreign scientist and fake passport racket
content: The accused, identified as Mohammad Adil Hussaini and also known by the names Syed Adil Hussain, Nasimuddin and Syed Adil Hussaini, was apprehended from Seemapuri in Delhi two days ago, who was allegedly associated with a foreign nuclear scientist based abroad.
